comments: a(n) is the number of subsets of {1,2,...,n} that do not have a cardinality of 2. - Geoffrey Critzer, Feb 25 2012.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: E.g.f.: exp(x)*(exp(x)-x^2/2!). - Geoffrey Critzer, Feb 25 2012G.f.: (1-3*x+2*x^2+x^3)/((1-x)^3*(1-2*x)). - Colin Barker, Apr 01 2012
mathematica: nn = 20;Range[0, nn]! CoefficientList[Series[Exp[x] (Exp[x] - x^2/2!), {x, 0, nn}], x] (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 25 2012 *)CoefficientList[Series[(1-3*x+2*x^2+x^3)/((1-x)^3*(1-2*x)),{x,0,33}],x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 18 2012 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
